skills.name: Interpret loci scenarios involving perpendicular bisectors
Understand key loci terms like equidistant and perpendicular
Identify mathematical instruments and their functions

explanations.A: "equi" means "equal". If two things are equidistant to me, they are both the same distance away from me.
explanations.B: To "bisect" is to split into two exactly equal parts.
explanations.C: Perpendicular means "at a right angle to".
explanations.D: To "construct" is to build or create.

explanations.B: A "bisector" splits something into two exactly equal parts.
explanations.C: Perpendicular means "at a right angle to".
explanations.D: We want a word that means "at the same distance".

explanations.C: The angle is being split into two exactly equal parts.
explanations.D: A circle goes all the way around a point.

explanations.B: A ruler is what you might use to draw straight lines.

explanations.A: See if you can spot any points that are horizontal or vertical from each other.
explanations.B: We can make a parallelogram with all lines the same length, or with two sides longer.
explanations.C: We can make a rhombus or a longer parallelogram. We can use one of the lowest or highest pairs of points to be a right angle.
explanations.D: Try imagining lines between some of the points. Do any point the same way? Are any horizontal or vertical?

explanations.A: Look at some of the points which are closest together, is this distance the same as any other?
explanations.B: A rhombus has 4 equal sides - can you use two of the ones from the triangle and join them with another two?
explanations.C: Both of these can be made using the smallest distance between points as the side length.
explanations.D: Try imagining lines between some of the points. Do any of the lengths look the same as each other?
